intro: Indigofera circinella, commonly known as the small indigo or dwarf indigo, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and trifoliate leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, displaying shades of pink, violet, or white. Indigofera circinella is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
